title: Privacy Policy
description: Learn how we collect, use, and protect your personal data.
intro1: FitVibe helps athletes and active individuals plan training sessions, log workouts, and understand their progress. This Privacy Policy explains what personal data we collect when you use the Services, why we collect it, how we use and share it, and the rights available to you under the General Data Protection Regulation ("GDPR"), the UK GDPR, and other applicable data protection laws.
intro2: By using the Services, you acknowledge that your personal data will be processed as described in this Privacy Policy.

section1.title: Scope
section1.subtitle: This Privacy Policy:
items: Applies to anyone who visits our sites or apps, creates an account, uses the Services, participates in communities, or otherwise interacts with FitVibe.

Covers all personal data processed by FitVibe acting as **controller**. When we process data strictly on behalf of organizations (for example, a club or employer using FitVibe for their members), those organizations are controllers and we act as **processor** in accordance with our data processing agreements.
Does **not** apply to third‑party services, websites, or devices that you choose to connect to FitVibe; their privacy practices are governed by their own policies.

section2.title: Who we are and how to contact us
section2.euRepresentativeValue: details will be published in localized supplements to this notice.
section2.contactNote: You may contact us at these addresses for any questions about this Policy or our handling of your personal data.

section3.title: Information we collect
section3.subtitle: We group the personal data we process into the following categories.

accountData.examples: Email address, username, password hash, account identifiers

profilePreferences.examples: Display name, avatar, locale, time zone, units (kg/lb, km/mi), language, visibility settings, contact preferences

trainingWellness.examples: Workout logs, exercises performed, sets/reps, loads, pace, heart‑rate or power data (if connected), RPE, body measurements, wellness check‑ins
trainingWellness.source: Provided by you or via integrations you connect

socialCommunity.examples: Comments, likes, messages, profile information visible to others, participation in teams or groups

deviceTechnical.examples: IP address, device identifiers, operating system, app version, browser type, language, time zone

usageDiagnostics.examples: Feature usage, clickstream and navigation data, performance metrics, crash reports, error logs

supportCommunication.examples: Messages you send to support, feedback, survey responses, and related metadata

paymentBilling.examples: Limited billing details such as billing address, transaction IDs (full card data is handled by our payment processor)

cookiesIds.examples: Cookie identifiers, mobile advertising IDs, and similar technology used for analytics and, where permitted, marketing

section3.specialCategoriesNote: We do **not** intend to collect special categories of data (such as medical diagnoses) unless clearly necessary for a feature and permitted by law. Where applicable, we will seek your explicit consent.

section4.title: Sources of information
section4.subtitle: We obtain personal data from:
items: **You**, when you create an account, update your profile, log workouts, participate in social features, or contact support.
**Your devices and browsers**, through cookies, SDKs, and similar technologies.
**Organizations** (such as clubs or employers) that provision accounts or integrate FitVibe with their internal systems.
**Third‑party services** (for example, wearables or calendar providers) that you connect to FitVibe, strictly according to your permissions.

section5.title: How we use your information
section5.subtitle: We use the personal data described above to:
items: Provide, operate, and maintain the Services, including planning tools, training logs, and analytics dashboards.
Personalize your experience, for example by adapting units, language, and suggested content to your profile.
Generate training summaries, trends, and insights across your historical data.
Authenticate you, secure accounts, detect and prevent fraud and abuse, and protect the integrity of the platform.
Operate social and community features such as following, comments, leaderboards, and shared plans, where you choose to use them.
Communicate with you about service updates, security notices, and administrative messages. Marketing communications are sent only where permitted by law and according to your preferences.
Conduct analytics to understand usage, improve performance, and plan new features, using aggregated or de‑identified data where possible.
Comply with legal obligations, enforce our Terms and Conditions/EULA, and protect FitVibe, our users, and the public from harm.

section6.title: Legal bases for processing (EEA, UK, and similar jurisdictions)
section6.subtitle: Where the GDPR, UK GDPR, or comparable laws apply, we rely on one or more of the following legal bases:

items.title: Performance of a contract:
items.content: To create and manage your account, provide the Services you request, and support your use of FitVibe.

items.title: Consent:
items.content: For example, when: - you opt‑in to marketing emails or push notifications, - you make certain content publicly visible, - you connect third‑party integrations or enable optional analytics and cookies where required by law. You may withdraw consent at any time, without affecting the lawfulness of processing before withdrawal.

items.title: Legitimate interests:
items.content: To maintain and improve the security, performance, and usability of the Services; to prevent abuse; and to understand how the Services are used, provided that these interests are balanced against your rights and freedoms.

items.title: Legal obligations:
items.content: To comply with accounting, tax, and regulatory requirements and to respond to lawful requests from public authorities.

items.title: Vital interests or public interest:
items.content: In rare cases, to protect life or physical safety or to comply with public health directives, where permitted by law.

section7.title: Cookies and similar technologies
section7.subtitle: We use cookies and similar technologies to:
items: keep you signed in and maintain session security;
remember your preferences (such as language and units);
measure usage and performance of the Services; and
support, where permitted, marketing and product development.
section7.cookieNote: Where required by law, we will present you with a cookie banner or settings to obtain your consent for non‑essential cookies and allow you to manage your preferences. For more information, please refer to our Cookie Policy (if available in your region).

section8.title: How we share information
section8.notSold: We do **not** sell your personal data.
section8.subtitle: We may share your personal data with:

items.title: Service providers and sub‑processors
items.content: For example, providers of cloud infrastructure, email/SMS delivery, analytics, error reporting, and customer support tools. Each provider is bound by a data processing agreement requiring confidentiality, appropriate security measures, and, where applicable, Standard Contractual Clauses ("SCCs").

items.title: Integrations and partners you choose
items.content: For example, if you connect a wearable device or calendar provider, we share only the data needed to enable that integration and only according to your configuration and the partner's terms.

items.title: Organizations that provision your account
items.content: If your account is created or managed by a coach, club, or employer, certain profile and activity data may be visible to designated administrators in accordance with their policies and our contracts with them.

items.title: Business transfers
items.content: In connection with a merger, acquisition, reorganization, or sale of assets, where your data may be transferred as part of the transaction, subject to confidentiality and, where required, notice to you.

items.title: Legal and safety
items.content: When necessary to comply with legal obligations, court orders, or lawful requests, or to enforce our terms and protect the rights, property, and safety of FitVibe, our users, or the public.

items.title: Aggregated or de‑identified data
items.content: We may use or share aggregated or de‑identified information for analytics, research, or product improvement, provided it does not identify any individual.

section9.title: International data transfers
section9.paragraph1: FitVibe may process and store your personal data in countries other than the one in which you reside. These countries may have data protection laws that differ from those in your jurisdiction.
section9.paragraph2: Where we transfer personal data from the EEA, UK, or Switzerland to countries that are not recognized as providing an adequate level of protection, we implement appropriate safeguards, such as:
items: Standard Contractual Clauses approved by the European Commission or UK authorities, and
additional technical and organizational measures based on transfer impact assessments, where required.
section9.paragraph3: You may request more information about these safeguards by contacting `privacy@fitvibe.example.com`.

section10.title: Data retention
section10.paragraph1: We retain personal data only for as long as reasonably necessary to: provide the Services and features you have requested; fulfil the purposes described in this Policy; comply with our legal and contractual obligations; and resolve disputes and enforce our agreements.
section10.paragraph2: In particular, subject to change as our services evolve:

items.title: Account, training, and social graph data
items.content: are kept while your account remains active. When you request deletion of your account, we apply a short grace period (typically 7 days) and then delete or irreversibly anonymize associated data.

items.title: Backups
items.content: containing personal data are rotated and purged within a limited window (typically 14 days after the effective deletion), using an automated process designed to support data subject rights.

items.title: Authentication tokens, idempotency records, and moderation queues
items.content: are pruned on rolling schedules (for example, between 24 hours and 180 days), depending on operational needs and security requirements.

items.title: Audit logs and security logs
items.content: are retained for a bounded period (for example, 180 days) to support incident response and compliance.

section10.paragraph3: When data is no longer required for these purposes, we either securely delete it or de‑identify it so that it can no longer be linked to you.

section11.title: Security
section11.subtitle: We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect personal data, including:
items: TLS (HTTPS) encryption in transit, with modern protocols and strict transport security;
access controls and role‑based permissions in production environments, with multi‑factor authentication and use of a secrets manager;
regular security updates, vulnerability management, and monitoring for anomalies;
malware scanning for uploads, and audit trails for key administrative and security‑relevant actions.
section11.note: No system can be completely secure. You remain responsible for choosing strong passwords, keeping them confidential, enabling multi‑factor authentication where available, and promptly notifying us of any suspected unauthorized access to your account.

section12.title: Your rights
section12.subtitle: Depending on your place of residence and applicable law, you may have some or all of the following rights:

items.title: Access
items.content: – to obtain confirmation as to whether we process your personal data and receive a copy of that data.

items.title: Rectification
items.content: – to have inaccurate or incomplete personal data corrected.

items.title: Erasure
items.content: – to request deletion of your personal data, subject to certain exceptions (for example, where retention is required by law).

items.title: Restriction
items.content: – to request that we restrict processing of your personal data in certain circumstances.

items.title: Objection
items.content: – to object to processing based on legitimate interests and, where applicable, to object to direct marketing at any time.

items.title: Data portability
items.content: – to receive your personal data in a structured, commonly used, and machine‑readable format and to transmit it to another controller where technically feasible.

items.title: Withdrawal of consent
items.content: – where processing is based on consent, you may withdraw it at any time without affecting the lawfulness of processing before withdrawal.

items.title: Complaint to a supervisory authority
items.content: – you may lodge a complaint with your local data protection authority if you believe our processing infringes applicable law.

section12.additionalRights: Residents of certain jurisdictions (for example, some U.S. states, Brazil, Canada) may have additional rights, such as rights to know, delete, or limit the use or disclosure of certain categories of information. These will be honored in accordance with the relevant statute.
section12.exerciseRights: You can exercise these rights by: using any self‑service tools provided in the app or account settings (for example, download or delete account functions), and/or contacting us at `privacy@fitvibe.example.com`.
section12.verification: We may need to verify your identity before acting on your request and may decline requests that are manifestly unfounded, excessive, or otherwise not required or permitted by law.

section13.title: Children's data
section13.subtitle: The Services are **not directed to children under 16**, or any higher age set by applicable law in your jurisdiction for online consent.
items: We do not knowingly collect personal data from children under the applicable minimum age.
If we learn that we have collected personal data from such a child without appropriate consent, we will delete it as soon as reasonably possible.
section13.contact: If you believe that a child has provided personal data to FitVibe in breach of this Policy, please contact us at `privacy@fitvibe.example.com`.

section14.title: Health and fitness considerations
section14.paragraph1: FitVibe provides training and wellness tooling. It is **not** a medical device and is **not** intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease.
section14.paragraph2: Nothing in the Services constitutes medical advice. You should consult qualified healthcare professionals before starting or modifying any training program, especially if you have existing health conditions.

section15.title: Changes to this Policy
section15.paragraph1: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time, for example when we introduce new features, use new providers, or when laws or regulatory guidance change.
items: The "Effective date" at the top of this Policy indicates when it last changed.
For material changes, we will provide additional notice, such as an in‑app notification or email.
The Policy is maintained in version control with historical versions retained for reference.
section15.paragraph2: Your continued use of the Services after changes take effect constitutes your acknowledgment of the updated Policy.

section16.title: How to contact us or exercise your rights
section16.subtitle: If you have questions about this Privacy Policy, our use of your personal data, or if you wish to exercise your rights, please contact:
section16.responseTime: We will respond without undue delay and within the time limits required by applicable data protection law (for example, one month under the GDPR, subject to permitted extensions for complex requests).
